org.dataconservancy.dcs.util

Class DateUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dataconservancy.dcs.util.DateUtility

  • public class DateUtility
extends Object
    Utility for parsing and converting dates.

    Provides means to parse and convert ISO 8601 and RFC 822 formatted dates into miliseconds since the epoch.

    • Method Detail

      • parseDate

        public static long parseDate(String date)
        Parse a date string into milliseconds since the epoch.

        Automatically determines date format in order to locate the correct parser. Currently, the following date time string formats are supported

        • ISO 8601 - year
        • ISO 8601 - basic date with no separators: yyyyMMdd
        • RFC 822
        • RFC 850
        • Common US date format: MM-dd-yyyy

        Parameters:
        date - String containing date in RFC 822 or ISO 8601 format.
        Returns:
        long containing time in milliseconds since the epoch. If the String could not be parsed, -1 value is returned.

      • parseIso8601BasicDate

        public static org.joda.time.DateTime parseIso8601BasicDate(String date)
        Parses Iso8601 basic formatted date string (yyyyMMdd) into a DateTime object.
        Parameters:
        date - The string in Iso8601 basic date format
        Returns:
        A DateTime object representing the date in the String,
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the date could not be parsed.

      • parseRfc822Date

        public static org.joda.time.DateTime parseRfc822Date(String date)
        Parses a Rfc822 formatted date string into a DateTime object
        Parameters:
        date - The string Rfc822 format.
        Returns:
        A DateTime object representing the date in the string, or null if the string isn't properly formatted.

      • parseRfc850Date

        public static org.joda.time.DateTime parseRfc850Date(String date)
        Parses a Rfc850 formatted date string into a DateTime object
        Parameters:
        date - The string Rfc850 format.
        Returns:
        A DateTime object representing the date in the string, or null if the string isn't properly formatted.

      • parseAscTime

        public static org.joda.time.DateTime parseAscTime(String date)
        Parses an ASC formatted date string into a DateTime object
        Parameters:
        date - The string Asc format.
        Returns:
        A DateTime object representing the date in the string, or null if the string isn't properly formatted.

      • parseDateString

        public static org.joda.time.DateTime parseDateString(String date)
        Parses a string of the following formats:
        • Rfc822
        • Rfc850
        • Asc
        • ISO8601
        • Common US date format MM-dd-yyyy
        into DateTime object with GMT timezone
        Parameters:
        date - The formatted string to parse
        Returns:
        A date time object with the formatted string, or null if the string doesn't match any of the formats.

      • parseDateString_WithTimeOffset

        public static org.joda.time.DateTime parseDateString_WithTimeOffset(String date)
        Parses a string of the following formats:
        • Rfc822
        • Rfc850
        • Asc
        • ISO0861
        • common US Date (MM-dd-yyyy)
        into a DateTime object with timeoff set value.
        Parameters:
        date - The formatted string to parse
        Returns:
        A date time object with the formatted string, or null if the string doesn't match any of the formats.

      • toIso8601_DateTime

        public static String toIso8601_DateTime(long timestamp)
        Returns a dateTime value into ISO 8601 format.

        Will return the UTC date to the millisecond precision. e.g. 2010-06-22T07:31.005Z

        Parameters:
        timestamp - miliseconds since the epoch.
        Returns:
        formatted date string.

      • toIso8601_DateTime

        public static String toIso8601_DateTime(Date date)
        Returns a dateTime value into ISO 8601 format.

        Will return the UTC date to the millisecond precision. e.g. 2010-06-22T07:31.005Z

        Parameters:
        date - the Date
        Returns:
        formatted date string.

      • toIso8601_DateTimeNoMillis

        public static String toIso8601_DateTimeNoMillis(Date date)
        Returns a dateTime value into ISO 8601 format.

        Will return the UTC date to the second precision. e.g. 2010-06-22T07:31Z

        Parameters:
        date - the Date
        Returns:
        formatted date string.

      • toIso8601_DateTimeNoMillis

        formatted date string.

      • toIso8601_BasicDate

        public static String toIso8601_BasicDate(long date)
        Returns a dateTime value into ISO 8601 Basic date format (yyyyMMdd).

        Will return the UTC date 20100617

        Parameters:
        date - the Date
        Returns:
        formatted date string.

      • toIso8601_year

        public static String toIso8601_year(long date)
        Returns a dateTime value into ISO 8601 year format (yyyy).

        Will return the UTC date 2010

        Parameters:
        date - the Date
        Returns:
        formatted date string.

      • toRfc822

        public static String toRfc822(long timestamp)
        Returns a dateTime value into RFC 822 format.

        Will return a date in second precision, truncating amy fractional seconds.

        Parameters:
        timestamp - miliseconds since the epoch.
        Returns:
        formatted date string.

      • toCommonUSDate

        public static String toCommonUSDate(org.joda.time.DateTime date)
        Returns a date only value in common US date format.

        Truncates any time value provided in the date object.

        Parameters:
        date - DateTime object presenting the date to be formatted
        Returns:
        date string in format MM-dd-yyyy

      • toCommonUSDate

        public static String toCommonUSDate(Date date)
        Returns a date only value in common US date format.

        Truncate any time value in the date object.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        date string in format MM-dd-yyyy

      • toCommonUSDate

        public static String toCommonUSDate(long date)
        Returns a date only value in common US date format.

        Truncates any time value provided along with the date.

        Parameters:
        date - long value presenting the date to be formatted
        Returns:
        date string in format MM-dd-yyyy
